name: Lemon Dill Salmon Fillet
author: LotusLikes2Eat
summary: This is honestly the best salmon you will ever taste! Lemony dill salmon fillets steamed to perfection in tin foil pouches accompanied by homemade tartar sauce! Quick. Simple. Delicious.
ingredients: ½ pound baby red and yellow potatoes, or to taste
1 cup fresh green beans, trimmed, or to taste
½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
directions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer
Add potatoes and green beans, cover, and steam until tender, about 10 minutes
Brush the shiny side of 2 large pieces of aluminum foil with 1 teaspoon olive oil each
Place salmon skin-side down in the center
Brush remaining olive oil and garlic over salmon
Divide lemon slices over salmon; squeeze 1/2 lemon on top
Season with 1/2 teaspoon pepper and 1/3 teaspoon salt
Cover salmon with 2 pieces of aluminum foil, shiny-side down
Roll aluminum foil inwards on all sides to create a pouch
Transfer pouches to a baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until salmon flakes easily with a fork, 10 to 12 minutes
Mix mayonnaise and capers together in a small bowl to make a tartar sauce
Stir in juice from 1 lemon, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon salt
Serve steamed potatoes, green beans, and tartar sauce alongside salmon
